root: ^Scanners indicate a foreign object will soon pass closely by the ship. Readings show that the object has an incredibly low temperature. As it draws closer, the crew realize they've been graced by the presence of a passing comet. They gather on the observation deck, eagerly anticipating the sight that awaits them. If the crew has time to watch this comet, then they should have time to do their jobs.

Party: ^The crew prepare food and drink for the viewing, and you watch from the external cameras. Soon, the comet comes into view. A brilliant blue light emanates from the celestial body. As it passes by the ship, the cold aura surrounding it creates a layer of frost upon the observation deck's main window. The spectacle has entranced the crew, with some even claiming that this was the best thing they have ever seen. After the comet disappears from view, the crew are in much higher spirits, eager to continue on this journey.
Close: ^You close the external shutters on the observation deck and inform the crew that they're not missing anything, just a floating hunk of ice and stone. This does little to curb their disappointment as they return to their stations, listless and bitter.
